comments.body: I think it would be an interesting visual cue of what a player is doing and would be cool in the game, but it does make the inventory visible to other players, and I liked the fact that only you really know what is in your inventory.
I mean like a backpack icon or something. What did you think I meant?
Here you go i think this would look great or something like it.
Well, maybe it would make you invincible (cuz nobody likes being sneak attacked by a creeper)

It would be helpful to know if someone is looking in their inventory cause that way you could know why they're just standing there and stuff lol, I usually know because I'm in party chat so I can just ask but still a cute addition. Plus....just gonna throw this out there it should be an optional feature because that might also alert your more trickster like friends when you're distracted and therefore when they can mess w/you easier lol! (which might add a layer of fun itself tbh)

I have an additional idea for this as well; perhaps it could create an interface like the villager trades where you can just give someone stuff vs toss it at them manually (or loading it in a chest) perhaps even make it an actual trade system! Oooh...you can charge what you want for items and people could take or leave the offer like w/a trader/villager that'd be rad :)
This would be very useful for multiplayer! It could also be a little 2D chest icon maybe?
I think this would hinder PVP too much. Your opponent always knowing when you're in your inventory(sorting soups/potions etc) would make you even more vulnerable than you already are doing so.
Yes, and by recoding the game from nothing (I know it would be so much work)

Great idea, in Minecraft Bedrock Edition they already did a pretty good job, you can play with a higher resolution there.
Also most games render things in the distant with lower resolution, Minecraft is literally kinda the only game which says: "Oh, there is this block which is that far, you can't really see it. Let's render it with FULL RESOLUTION to cause the maximum lag"
Would be great if they change something there.
This also applies to the Bedrock Edition, as far as I know.

Also at the time of minecrafts creation quad cores werent really wide spread and duo core cpu where more a thing. So notch didnt bother implementing hyperthreating. Which means minecraft only uses a single core. While implementing hyperthreating does mean a total rewrite of the game. I think some form of optimisation must he done. Otherwise the game (on newest version) becomes unplayable on a large amount of pc's

To increase performance while working on general game optimization, you could set the world build options to an "Old" way that would take world builds from 1.17.1 and below to build worlds with features of the 1.18 up.
They should add like LOD (like in the Distant Horizon mod) and like rendering only what is on our view
Fixed title to make it more inclusive of non-realms.
this is an issue mainly with how powerful your device is. on a good PC, you could get upwards of 80 chunk render distance.
That would be great
Great idea
My device should be able to handle more than just 6 chunks. :/
Yes plz I need to see more than 6 chunks, I can't see anything basically

1. Too many people play on Mobile, it it a much worse experience than Xbox, PS4 or PC (I play PC)

2. Phones aren't even as good as computers from 5 years ago yet, their main processor has either half of the speed, or half of the overall amount of processors to be as good as them yet. And unless you have a ROG Phone or ROG Phone II, I don't expect anyone to be getting a playable frame rate (Unless you're on iOS, if this applies to you, you're a fool.) above at the most of 8 chunks. Also an Xbox One X costs less than the average phone these days so just get one of those.
Yes! My iPad used to have great render distance, but one update a while back locked it at 6 chunks or less. We should have an option to override the "recommended" render distance for the device.

I don't know what you all are talking about cuz the new iPad 8 can do a render distance of 32 chunks with not lag/FPS drops what so ever. And the new iPad Pro (2020) can do a render distance of 64 chunks no lag so yeah rly don't know what you all talking about. And my old iPhone 7 can do a render distance of 18 chunk also no lag what so ever.

I agree with every thing you said. I see so many cool builds using the stripped spruce log on java and try to recreate it in bedrock and it does not look good at all. I just don’t understand the reason for making the stripped spruce log darker in bedrock.
I mean yeah, Come on why? There's no reason to make these textures different
There is a parity category. Maybe the mods can move it?
PLEASE MOJANG!!! I build with spruce all the time, and it really annoys me that I can't build with your beautiful blocks.
This is a super easy change. Please make it :(
It is already added, but with maps that are cheaper and more comfortable for the player.

Wait, there are waypoints in bedrock?  How?  Is it a mod or in vanilla?  I must be blind or stupid because I tried it and nothing showed up on my map.  Can someone post a link to show me what I am doing wrong?

EDIT: if this isn’t already in the game then let me second the motion.  I desperately want more tools to mark maps.  It would add sooooooo much to the game and help to make it feel like a real world.

EDIT2: okay, when people mentioned waypoints I thought this meant a way to label what was on your maps and provide more detail.  Apparently, the green arrows that you can slap on your maps are also waypoints, which are definitely in BE/PE.  This is all fine and dandy, but I would like to see something much more detailed….. at least different colors other than green to create a scheme to mark places.  Definitely needs more….
I agree, it'd help when doing long term exploring of a world now that bedrock is nearly infinite. It'd also be great for role playing servers where you have shops, homes, etc. marked.

If waypoints are not added to bedrock, then at least be able to possibly dye the item frame that you hang the map on so the marker on the map changes to the same color that you dye the item frame so you can at least have a way to color code what specific points you are labeling for your maps. Hopefully that makes sense....

Or have the ability to rename the map so when your curser hovers over the dot, you would be able to see the name of that map that you hung elsewhere.

It sucks at the moment on Bedrock. You can only really make landmarks by placing copies of one Locator Map on Item Frames. These only show up as green pointers and that is annoying to know where everything is in the world. We DO NEED THIS in Bedrock.

I didn't know this feature existed on Java Edition. They absolutely need to add this to Bedrock.

Waypoints on maps have been one of my biggest issues with moving back to playing Minecraft without mods as the mods have their own minimap mods active that just give you a map on your interface by default.

I won't mention the name of the mod or the mod service as I don't know what Mojang's policy is regarding mods.
They did this to make it look distinct from other armour, so maybe make it like the color, but not the same color.
I do not understand.
Then if the villagers looked different they wouldn’t match the current texture unless it was changed too.
you just need to download and use a realistic texture pack

VIBRANT VISUALS SHOULD BE COMPATIBLE FOR LOW-END DEVICES
1. Vibrant visuals should be compatible with low-end devices so that more players can access and enjoy the game regardless of their hardware. 2. Supporting low-end devices allows the game to reach a bigger audience, which helps build a stronger player base. 3. Players on weaker devices deserve the same level of immersion as those on high-end devices, and optimized vibrant visuals make the experience fairer. 4. Immersion does not always require heavy graphics; with proper optimization, vibrant colors and visuals can run smoothly even on low-end hardware. 5. Ensuring that vibrant visuals work across all devices gives the game a positive reputation, since players feel included and valued. 6. Appealing visuals that remain smooth on low-end devices encourage players to stay engaged and play for longer periods. 7. By making vibrant visuals compatible with weaker hardware, the game becomes more future-proof, since not everyone upgrades to newer devices quickly.
Agreed! The new UI is really nice-looking, but joinable friends being hidden away and having less information seems silly.
Basically Minecraft was built to be 16x16 and not have a 1028x1028 variant
The reason pocket edition does not have ray tracing is because mobile devices lack the technological capabilities to run with ray tracing. Therefore this idea is unfortunately impossible.
the reason they dont is because minecraft hasnt been optimized for that consle but i agree
Pesaría más de lo que pesa minecraft
You don’t need Optifine on Bedrock.
Nether stars in Bedrock Editon cannot flash as an item entity, as they never despawn naturally in that edition.
If an item entity’s age is 5800, its remaining life is 200 ticks. So that gives it 10 seconds to flash.
It is currently open to a limited selection of players.
Why not?
I like this idea! I’m just curious if this could be implemented in all versions. For ◇Parity◇
NO

Semi-support. I like certain ideas (like the gold and emerald ones), but they'd all have to be balanced. The redstone trim ability would break a lot of contraptions.

Redstone - Quicker regeneration when near redstone blocks. (better with each piece)

Copper - Higher chance of lightning striking the area around you. (better with each piece)

Gold - Calms piglins.

Emerald - Lowers villager trades by 5% each. (better with each piece)

Diamond - Better chance of finding ore veins. (better with each piece)

Lapis - Lowers enchantment lapis requirements by 5% each. (better with each piece)

Amethyst - Makes music when walking. Instrument depends on ground material. (only for boots)

Quartz - Higher chance of better loot. (better with each piece)

Iron - Improved tool durability.

Netherite - When you're on fire, the flames go out quicker.

Let armor trim work like a reforging that improves some stats at the expense of others.
For example, we could forge spikes on boots so that movement on the ice is slip-free and faster, in return, sneaking will be louder due to the sound of spikes.
Or a visor on a helmet, improves protection, but reduces the field of view.
Too unbalanced, it's intentionally cosmetics.
I think it would fit better if it went for the trim type you are using, not the material
Yes, I definitely agree. I think this could also be done with player animations, too.
This is why I don’t spend a dime in the marketplace
The activation of a beacon is not a block state. The debug stick changes block states.
The opening of a chest or shulker box is not a change in block state. You can tell because the block performs an animation, and doesn’t just swap/flip textures.
I know but it would still be cool nonetheless, even it's a bit harder to implement

An optional shader can be built into the game.
There are many such posts, please vote for the previous ones.
Сам тоже хотел бы такое)
Unnecessary, their clothing already changes for this.

So, make it so books and quills can be edited like a Word document or Google Doc? I like that idea!

I don’t know about the custom images though. How would you change those?
